Key Match Events: Klaus Gjasula scored the fastest own goal in Euros history.
Qazim Laci squeezed a header home on 11 minutes for Albania's first goal.
Andrej Kramaric cut a lovely finish into the bottom corner for Croatia's first goal.
Klaus Gjasula turned into his own net via an unfortunate ricochet 14 minutes from time, giving Croatia the lead.
Klaus Gjasula scored a late equalizer in the fifth minute of stoppage time to earn Albania a draw.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Croatia were shaky at the back and pedestrian in possession but improved in the second half.
Albania's goalkeeper Thomas Strakosha made eight saves overall and was key in the draw.
The result sees Albania remain in third spot behind Italy and leaders Spain.
Croatia sit bottom of the group with a negative goal difference.
